elements.text: hey guys. Is there a trick to add ticks to right and top axes?

text:
almost got it (in ugly way), just need to remove labels from the ticks
```let
    y = rand(10)
    plot(y)
    plot!(twinx(), y, α=0, minorticks=true, )
    plot!(twiny(), y, α=0, minorticks=true, )
end
#
# where 
#
function twiny(sp::Plots.Subplot)
    sp[:top_margin] = max(sp[:top_margin], 30Plots.px)
    plot!(sp.plt, inset = (sp[:subplot_index], bbox(0,0,1,1)))
    twinsp = sp.plt.subplots[end]
    twinsp[:xaxis][:mirror] = true
    twinsp[:background_color_inside] = RGBA{Float64}(0,0,0,0)
    Plots.link_axes!(sp[:yaxis], twinsp[:yaxis])
    twinsp
end
twiny(plt::Plots.Plot = current()) = twiny(plt[1])```
twiny is discussed there
<https://stackoverflow.com/questions/64176617/julia-two-x-axes-for-plot-of-same-data>
